elements.name: ApplicantName
elements.title: What is your name?
elements.description: You may enter a name you use in your everday life even if it does not match your ID exactly.

elements.name: ApplicantDOB
elements.title: What is your Date of Birth?

elements.name: ExplanationServiceAddress
elements.title: You need to give an address where you can receive court documents. You do not have to use your home address. You can pick any address, such as your workplace or a lawyer's address, if you have one. The family member making you or your family feel unsafe will see this address.

elements.name: ApplicantAddress
elements.title: What is your address for receiving court documents?

elements.name: LawyerAddress
elements.title: Is this a lawyer's address?
elements.description: You can use one if you pay your lawyer to send and receive mail for you.

elements.name: LawyerName
elements.title: What is the lawyer's name?

elements.name: LawyerEmail
elements.title: Lawyer's Email (Optional)

elements.name: LawyerPhone
elements.title: Lawyer's Phone Number

elements.name: LawyerFax
elements.title: Lawyer's Fax Number (Optional)

elements.name: ApplicantPhone
elements.title: Daytime Phone Number

elements.name: ApplicantFax
elements.title: Fax Number (Optional)

elements.name: ApplicantEmail
elements.title: Email (Optional)

elements.name: ApplicantPageEnd
elements.title: Finished this page. Next you will add information about the person who is making you or your children feel unsafe. After that you will add children.

elements.name: RespondentName
elements.title: What is the name of the person that is making you (or your family) feel unsafe?
elements.description: If you know how their name is written on their ID cards, that will be the most useful.
elements.placeHolder: Full Name Here If you know it

elements.name: RespondentIsExPartner
elements.title: Is {RespondentName} a current or ex-partner of {ApplicantName}?

elements.name: RespondentIsChildsParent
elements.title: Is {RespondentName} a parent or guardian of any of {ApplicantName}'s child?

elements.name: RespondentIsChildParentsRelative
elements.title: Is {RespondentName} a relative of {ApplicantName}'s child's parent or guardian?

elements.name: RespondentIsExPartnersPartner
elements.title: Is {RespondentName} a current partner of {ApplicantName}'s ex-partner?

elements.name: RespondentIsLiveInRelative
elements.title: Is {RespondentName} a relative of {ApplicantName} who lives with {ApplicantName}?

elements.name: RespondentNotFamily
elements.title: {RespondentName} needs to be a family member of {ApplicantName} (or their children). You can't just put in any random citizen. Try a peace bond maybe.

elements.name: RespondentDOB
elements.title: What is {RespondentName}'s date of birth?
elements.description: You can still use this service without this information. A Protection Order is most effective with this information.

elements.name: RespondentDOBIDK
elements.title: I don't know the exact date

elements.name: RespondentAddress
elements.title: What is an address where {Respondent} can receive court documents?
elements.description: You can pick a daytime address such as {RespondentName}'s workplace or somewhere you know {RespondentName} will be staying.

elements.name: RespondentPhone
elements.title: Daytime Phone Number

elements.name: RespondentFax
elements.title: Fax Number (Optional)

elements.name: RespondentEmail
elements.title: Email (Optional)

elements.name: ExistingFamilyCasePanel
ExistingFamilyCase
elements.title: Is there already a Family Law case open between {ApplicantName} and {RespondentName} in the Provincial Court of British Columbia?

elements.name: ExistingCourt
elements.title: Court Location

elements.name: ExistingFileNumber
elements.title: File Number

elements.name: ExistingStyleOfProceeding
elements.title: Spell out the exact Style of Proceeding
elements.description: This is at the top of the documents and usually looks like "Name1 vs Name2".

elements.title: Existing Family Case Information

elements.name: PageEndRespondent
elements.title: Finished this page. Next you will add information about the person who is making you or your children feel unsafe. After that you will add children.

elements.name: ChildrenInvolved
elements.title: Does {ApplicantName} and/or {RespondentName} have children?

elements.name: ListOfChildren
elements.title: List of Children

templateElements.name: ChildDOB
templateElements.title: If you know it, enter {panel.ChildName}'s exact Date of Birth

templateElements.name: AdultChildDependent
templateElements.title: Although considered an adult,  {panel.ChildName} may still be a dependent. Does {panel.ChildName} depend on either {ApplicantName} or {RespondentName} for any of the following reasons?

choices.text: Yes, due to some other reason(s)

templateElements.name: ChildApplicantCare
templateElements.visibleIf: {panel.isChild} = 'n' and ( ({panel.AdultChildDependent} contains 'school') or ({panel.AdultChildDependent} contains 'disability') or ({panel.AdultChildDependent} contains 'illness') or ({panel.AdultChildDependent} contains 'other') )
templateElements.title: Does {ApplicantName} provide financing support to {panel.ChildName} for any of these situations?

templateElements.name: ChildRespondentCare
templateElements.visibleIf: {panel.isChild} = 'n' and ( ({panel.AdultChildDependent} contains 'school') or ({panel.AdultChildDependent} contains 'disability') or ({panel.AdultChildDependent} contains 'illness') or ({panel.AdultChildDependent} contains 'other') )
templateElements.title: Does {RespondentName} provide financing support to {panel.ChildName} for any of these situations?

templateElements.name: ChildNeedsProtection
templateElements.title: Does {panel.ChildName} need to be included on the Family Law Protection Order against {RespondentName}?

templateElements.name: ExplanationChildIsAdultNoProtection
templateElements.title: Even if {panel.ChildName} does not need to be included in the Protection Order, the judge will still need information about {panel.ChildName} in order to make fair decision.

templateElements.name: ExplanationChildIsAdultNoPOR
templateElements.title: Because {panel.ChildName} is an adult, not supported financially for a special obligation and does not need to be included in the Protection Order, {panel.ChildName} will not be included on your documents.

templateElements.name: GuardianIsNotParent
templateElements.title: A parent is not the same as a guardian.

templateElements.name: ChildEqualPTime
templateElements.title: Does {panel.ChildName} spend time equally between {ApplicantName} and {RespondentName}?

templateElements.name: ChildMainGuardians
templateElements.title: Who does {panel.ChildName} spend the most time with?

templateElements.name: ChildApplicantUnequalPTime
templateElements.title: How much time does {RespondentName} spend with {panel.ChildName}?

templateElements.name: ChildRespondentUnequalPTime
templateElements.title: How much time does {ApplicantName} spend with {panel.ChildName}?

templateElements.name: ChildApplicantContactOrder
templateElements.title: Is there an agreement or court order respecting this contact?

templateElements.name: ChildApplicantContactTerms
templateElements.title: What kind of contact does {ApplicantName} have with {panel.ChildName}?

choices.text: As agreed upon to between {ApplicantName} and {RespondentName}
Supervised contact in presence of someone else

templateElements.name: ChildRespondentContactOrder
templateElements.title: Is there an agreement or court order respecting this contact?

templateElements.name: ChildRespondentContactTerms
templateElements.title: What kind of contact does {ApplicantName} have with {panel.ChildName}?

choices.text: As agreed upon to between {ApplicantName} and {RespondentName}
Supervised contact in presence of someone else

templateElements.name: InfoNeeded
templateElements.expression: iif( {panel.isChild} = 'n' and {panel.ChildNeedsProtection} = 'n' and {panel.AdultChildDependent} contains 'no', 'n', iif( {panel.ChildNeedsProtection} empty, 'n', 'y' )

elements.name: NoContactRespondentSummary
elements.title:
This is a list of people who you want to be included on a Family Law Protection Order against {RespondentName}:
ApplicantName
{panel.ChildName}
{child2.name} If the judge grants this Protection Order, {RespondentName} must stay away from [names] or they will be charged as a criminal.

elements.name: PORPanelNoContactExceptions
RespondentApplicantContact
elements.title: Would {RespondentName} need to contact {ApplicantName} for an ongoing court case?

elements.name: RespondentApplicantContactParties
elements.title: Are there any third parties that {RespondentName} and {ApplicantName} can communicate through?

elements.name: RespondentApplicantArrangeChildren
elements.title: [Need help with logic - If there is at least one child who does not need protection] Does {RespondentName} need to contact you to arrange parenting responsibilities?

elements.name: RespondentApplicantArrangeMethods
elements.title: What is your preferred method for {RespondentName} to contact you?

elements.name: RespondentApplicantContactOther
elements.title: Is there any other reason that {RespondentName} would need to contact you?

elements.name: RespondentApplicantContactOtherReason
elements.title: Describe the reason(s)?
Even with a Protection Order in place, there may be times where it is important to contact each other.

elements.name: RespondentLiveTogether
elements.title: Does {RespondentName} currently live with {ApplicantName} or {panel.ChildName}?
elements.description: we'll need lots of info here or expanding question topic about what it means to "currently live" with someone. in other words, ran away to a shelter/couch surfing vs moved out a month ago. FLA 184(4)

elements.name: RespondentLeaving
elements.title: Do you, {ApplicantName}, want to stay in the family home?

elements.name: RespondentNeedPolice
elements.title: Do you think you need the police to remove {RespondentName} from your family home or are they leaving on their own?

choices.text: {RespondentName} will probably leave on their own

elements.name: HomeAddressSame
elements.title: Is the address of your family home the same as the address you provided for receiving court documents? [Display applicant's service address]

elements.name: FamilyHomeAddress
elements.title: What is the address of your family home?

elements.name: RespondentNoGo
elements.title: Are there any places, other than your home, where {RespondentName} needs to stay away from?

elements.name: ExplanationNoGoAddresses
elements.title: For this service, you do not need to give the addresses of the places you want {RespondentName} to stay away from. However, the judge may request them for the Protection Order so be prepared to bring the address into the courtroom with you.

elements.name: RespondentHasStuff
elements.title: Does {RespondentName} have any of [list of pending protected parties]'s personal belongings?

elements.name: RespondentHasStuffPolice
elements.title: Do you think you need police assistance to get personal belongings from {RespondentName}?

elements.name: RespondentHasStuffAddressSame
elements.title: Same as {RespondentName}'s address that you provided for receiving court documents? [Display respondent's service address]

elements.name: RespondentHasStuffAddress
elements.title: What is the address where your personal belongs are being held?

elements.name: RespondentNeedsStuff
elements.title: Does [names of pending protected parties] have any {RespondentName}'s personal belongings?
elements.description: Leave out the stolen items. make the help text more about clothing and daily-needed items. the whole point is to avoid having to come back and forth to grab stuff each time.

elements.name: RespondentNeedsStuffPolice
elements.title: Does you need the police to go with {RespondentName} to get their personal belongings from you?

elements.name: RespondentNeedsStuffAddressSame
elements.title: Is the address where you are holding {RespondentName}'s personal belongings the same as the address you provided for receiving court documents? [Display applicant's service address]

elements.name: RespondentNeedsStuffAddress
elements.title: Address

elements.name: RespondentWeapons
elements.title: Are you afraid [Respondent] will harm you or family members with weapons (including guns, explosives)?

elements.name: RespondentNoWeapons
elements.title: By selecting no above, you are saying there is no need for a judge to order {RespondentName} to give up their weapons if they have any. They also won't be able to possess any weapons for the duration of this Protection Order. If there is no concern over weapons, select "There is no concern over weapons" Otherwise, consider going back to the last question and selecting 'yes' instead.

choices.text: There is no concern over weapons

elements.name: Resident1Firearms
elements.title: Do you think {RespondentName} has guns, explosives or any other kind of firearm?

elements.name: RespondentNonFirearms
elements.title: Do you think {RespondentName} has weapons that are not guns or explosives?
elements.description: Knives are for cooking but could be used a weapon. Say Yes if they're particularly stabby but no if they're just an avid cook. Use this quesiton as a place to define what weapons are and why we are asking. Use definition of Criminal Code.

elements.name: ApplicationReview
elements.title: This is a review of everything. Show the box and show summary. Edit button to go back to topic page.

elements.name: RespondentPORTime
elements.title: Protection Orders usually last 1 year from the date the judge makes the order. Do you wish to make the order last a different amount of time?

elements.name: RespondentPORNewTime
elements.title: What date do you think the POR should expire?
elements.description: You will need to explain to the judge why you think this new date matters.

elements.name: RespondentCarryCopy
elements.title: Do you need [Respondent] to carry a copy of this order (if it is granted) on their person at all times for the duration of order.

elements.name: ExplanationDoneMainForm
elements.title: Tell someone they finish the form. This is what it looks like. Here's next steps. By the way, urgency questions

elements.name: PORSpeedup
elements.title: Do you feel you need this protection order sooner?

elements.name: PORSpeed
elements.title: How soon do you need this protection order?

elements.name: PORSpeedNormalAffidavit
elements.title: Does you want to write an affidavit using this service?
elements.description: Writing an affidavit is optional. Some judges really like it and may actually request it at a later date.

elements.name: ExplanationYesSpeedup
elements.title: This means that you need fill out more forms and wait for a judge to decide whether they will hear you or not.

elements.name: PORWhatHappened
elements.title: Q1 What Happened? (This stuff should not be saved into the database)

elements.name: PORWhyASAP
elements.title: Q2 Why do you need the POR Faster? (This stuff should not be saved into the database)

elements.name: PORWhyNoNotice
elements.title: Q3 Why do you need the POR granted with no notice? (This stuff should not be saved into the database)

elements.name: PageEndReview
elements.title: Print Forms and take them to the courthouse
